intro: Agrimonia eupatoria subsp. dahurica, commonly known as Siberian agrimony, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, branched clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and often covered in fine pubescence. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for digestive and skin ailments.
